attributes.action: Add a "Download" tax to internet bill's
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Earlier this week The Songwriters Association of Canada proposed a monthly fee on subscribers’ Internet bills that would make it legal to download music. 

This approach would be more productive and less costly for the entertainment business,ISP's,and everyone else. It will also relieve concerns about privacy .

This download fee/tax should be a choice that a customer makes with their ISP, if they choose not to pay e.g. £5-10 extra then they may face prosecution. 

The "war" with peer to peer networks can not be won. For every aggressive move made against file sharing, file sharing "world" make their own moves. It is time for forward thinking and to embrace the new digital media and the way it is distributed
